ETYMOLOGY: From un- (not) + believable. Believable derived from believe + -able. Attested use of the combined form primarily since the 17th century.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Extremely difficult or impossible to believe; too improbable or astonishing to accept as true.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 难以置信的；极不可能或令人震惊而无法接受的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The speed at which the runner finished the marathon was absolutely unbelievable.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位跑者完成马拉松的速度简直令人难以置信。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used colloquially as an intensifier to express extreme admiration, approval, or sometimes severe negative impact (amazing or appalling).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极好的；惊人的；了不起的 (口语中用作强调或感叹，可褒可贬)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The view from the top of the mountain was unbelievable.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 山顶上的景色简直美得令人难以置信。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used alone to express strong surprise, shock, frustration, or annoyance, usually in response to a negative or frustrating event.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 真叫人受不了！难以置信！ (常用于表示震惊、沮丧或愤怒的感叹词)
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: “你又把钥匙弄丢了？真叫人受不了！”

REGISTER: General, often informal when used as an intensifier.
